name: IBM Resilient
description: Query incidents within the IBM Resilient Incident Response Platform

options.name: Resilient URL
options.description: Your Resilient URL to include the schema (i.e., https://)

options.name: Resilient API Key ID
options.description: Your Resilient API Key ID. You must authenticate with either an "API Key ID" and "API Key Secret", or a "username" and "password", but not both.

options.name: Resilient API Key Secret
options.description: Your Resilient API Key Secret token value. You must authenticate with either an "API Key ID" and "API Key Secret", or a "username" and "password", but not both.

options.name: Resilient Username
options.description: Your Resilient username.  (We recommend using the API Key ID, and API Key Secret authentication options)

options.name: Resilient Password
options.description: Your Resilient password. (We recommend using the API Key ID, and API Key Secret authentication options)

options.name: Workspaces to Search
options.description: Comma delimited list of workspaces to search.  If left blank, all workspaces accessible to the provided API key or user will be searched.  Workspace names are case-sensitive.  This option should be set to "Only admins can view and edit"

options.name: Types to Search
options.description: Choose the data types that should be searched

options.name: Days to Search
options.description: The number of days back to search. For example, if set to 365, the integration will limit results to incidents created in the last 365 days. Defaults to 365 days.

options.name: Ignored List
options.description: List of domains or IPs (space delimited) that you never want to send to DNSDB

options.name: Ignored Domain Regex
options.description: Domains that match the given regex will not be looked up.  Should be set to "Only admins can view and edit".
